thread.title: REVIEW: West End Exchange, Southampton Musical Society, The Berry
thread.title_full: REVIEW: West End Exchange, Southampton Musical Society, The Berry

title: REVIEW: West End Exchange, Southampton Musical Society, The Berry
text:
0 comments 
THE premise for the show: take songs from fourteen very diverse musicals and change them in some way. 
Gender-changes added a different dimension and the talented cast – more than 30 strong – sang, danced and enjoyed every minute, as did the highly-appreciative audience. 
Sam and Jo Gregory put the show together, with Will Pickering’s backing tracks and Paul and Kate Warne’s inventive, energetic choreography. 
My pick of the first-half performances were those by Karla Brown’s Bui Doi from Miss Saigon , Sarah-Louise Ellard’s I Believe from Book of Mormon , Dawn Butterfield’s comic Dentist (Little Shop of Horrors) and Paul Rogers and Sam Gregory’s Defying Gravity (Wicked) . 
I particularly enjoyed the show-closers: Rent’s electrifying I Will Cover You , led by Aimee Wright, and the acapella La Vie Boheme . Share article 
After opening the show in style with A Chorus Line’s Dance 10: Looks 3 , Daniel Ferrett ended it with the emotional Dream Girls showstopper And I Am Telling You . Great stuff. 
Alan Johns REVIEW: West End Exchange, Southampton Musical Society, The Berry Sorry, an error occurred.
